law.catch_line: A license expires on the date set by the Board, unless the license is renewed for an additional term...

text.section: A license expires on the date set by the Board, unless the license is renewed for an additional term as provided in this section. A license may not be renewed for a term of longer than 2 years.

At least 1 month before a license expires, the Board shall send to each licensee, by first-class mail to the last known address of the licensee, a renewal form and a renewal notice that states:
The date on which the current license expires;
That the renewal application and fee must be received by the Board on or before the license expiration date; and
The amount of the renewal fee.

A licensee periodically may renew a license for an additional term if the licensee:
Otherwise is entitled to be licensed;
Pays a renewal fee set by the Board; and
Submits to the Board:
A renewal application on the form that the Board requires; and
Satisfactory evidence of compliance with the continuing education requirements set by the Board under this section for license renewal.

section.section: The Board may establish continuing education requirements as a condition to the renewal of licenses under this section.
Any requirements established under this subsection shall reflect current educational methods and chiropractic techniques.

text.section: The Board shall renew the license of and issue a renewal certificate to each licensee who meets the requirements of this section.
